fdd:FDD.titleName: MPEG-4, Visual Coding, Simple Studio Profile

fdd:identificationAndDescription.fdd:fullName: ISO/IEC 14496-2:2004. Information technology -- Coding of audio-visual objects -- Part 2: VisualSimple Studio Profile (formal name); MPEG-4, Visual Coding, Simple Studio Profile (common name)

fdd:description.p: See also MP4_FF_2 and MPEG-4_V. Offers very high quality for studio editing applications.
The Simple Studio Profile permits the use of the following visual object type:

ul.li: Simple studio: arbitrarily shaped video, uses intra (I) video object planes (VOPs, the MPEG-4 term for frames) only. This type differs from the MPEG-4 simple object type and has syntax closer to MPEG-2 to permit easy transcoding and does not permit the use of predicted (P) VOPs.

fdd:description.p: Four compression levels are permitted, with bit rates from 180 to 1,800 Mbps.

fdd:identificationAndDescription.fdd:shortDescription: MPEG-4 encoding profile that offers very high quality for studio editing applications.
fdd:identificationAndDescription.fdd:productionPhase: Generally an initial- or middle-state format, used in video production.

fdd:relatedTo.fdd:titleName: MPEG-4 File Format, V.2, with Visual Coding (All Profiles)

fdd:sustainabilityFactors.fdd:adoption: Actual adoption not known to the compilers of this document.

fdd:movingImageQF.fdd:clarity: See MPEG-4 and MPEG-4_V. Potential for greater clarity at a given picture size, data rate, and encoding algorithm, than most other MPEG-4 profiles, e.g., Simple, Simple Scalable, Advanced Simple, Core, and Main Profiles.

fdd:other.fdd:tag: File type brand (ISO Base Media File Format)

fdd:values.fdd:note: Indicated in file wrapper and relates to "brands" defined in ISO_BMFF. Wrapping MPEG-4_V bitstreams in MP4_FF_1 would occasion the use of mp41; in MP4_FF_2, use mp42. See Part 15 of the standard, pp. 2-9, 13.

fdd:other.fdd:tag: Indicator for profile, level, version, etc.

fdd:values.fdd:note: Indicators for Simple Studio Profile, levels 1, 2, 3, and 4 are 11100001, 11100010, 1110011, 11100100, respectively. From Annex G of ISO/IEC 14496-2:2004, Table G.1.
